CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 24, 1946 reads: "Citizen's Committee - Members of the North Side Citizens' Committee make final plans to enlist aid of Elder Charles Beck, radio minister, in their campaign against prejudice and bigotry in Pennsylvania. The Committee plans an all-out battle against the Ku Klux Klan and other subversive forces and hopes to be able to persuade the radio preacher to assist in campaign.  Members of the committee are: Percy Love, Oleion Alexander, the Rev. Wylie Jordan, L. Matthews and Edward Campbell.  -Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of five members of the North Side Citizen's Committee, left to right; Percy Love, Oleion Alexander, the Rev. Wylie Jordan, L. Matthews and Edward Campbell, standing in church with pews on left and along wall
